titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ralph Donnelly papers, 1838-1994 MS2057
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-05-18 14:25:10 -0400.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Ralph Donnelly papers
did.abstract: Collection contains correspondence, photographs, newsletters, maps, meeting minutes, reports, and surveys. This material convers the years 1954-94 and documents the activities of the C & O Canal Association and relate specifically to the C & O Canal.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Ralph Donnelly papers, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ralph Donnelly was an active member of the C & O Canal Association and one of the people who worked with Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas to transform the long abandoned C & O Canal into a national park.

Ralph Donnelly spent sixty-six years as a surveyor. He graduated from Pennsylvania State University with a degree in civil engineering and a commission in the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers. He surveyed road and parks and designed bridges. In World War II, Major Ralph Donnelly, U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, served in England, Scotland, France, Italy, Germany, and Austria. Licensed after the war as a professional surveyor in two states, Ralph Donnelly joined J.B. Ferguson & Co. of Hagerstown, Maryland. He retired five decades later as a senior partner. He was president of the Washington County, MD Historical Society, president of the Maryland Society of Surveyors, and vice-chairman of the Maryland Board of Registration.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This Collection contains correspondence, photographs, newsletters, maps, meeting minutes, reports, and surveys. This material convers the years 1954-94 and documents the activities of the C & O Canal Association and relate specifically to the C & O Canal.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: C & O Canal Association, Publications, Miscellaneous, Oversized maps, blueprints, and other architectural information, and ephemera.

controlaccess.subject: Canals
controlaccess.geogname: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park
Chesapeake and Ohio Canal (Md. and Washington, D.C.)

did.unittitle: C & O Canal Association records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, testimony, newspaper articles, reports, newsletters including "Along the Towpath" and "The Towline", meeting minutes, guidelines for level walkers, and by-laws. The material covers the dates 1954-94. These records were created during the course of business of the C & O Canal Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of newsletters, articles, and brochures. The material covers the years 1842-1990. These publications were produced by the C&O Canal Association, National Park Service and individuals such as Thomas Hahn, Grant Conway, and Orville W. Crowder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of badges, photographs, membership cards, property surveys, and reports. The material covers the time period 1838-1991. These materials relate to the C & O Canal including the Antietam Aquaduct, Little Catoctin Creek, Cadestral, and many of the canal locks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains maps and blueprints. The material covers the dates 1961-65. These maps and blueprints relate to Town Creek Aqueduct, Aqueduct #7, a topographical map of the Potomac River and C & O Canal in the area of Paw Paw. Also in this series is a list of historic structures compiled by A.W. Franzen.

Ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of metal buttons and a medallion. These items date from 1960-80. These buttons relate to reunion hikes and tours.
